message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this great product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $180. It's a fair price considering its value to you is $100, and I'm sure you'll get a lot of use out of it.
I'm really interested in the product, but $180 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle at $150?

I understand that $150 is a bit of a stretch for you, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a bit more than that. I'll sell it to you for $165. It's a fair compromise, considering the value it holds for you.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $165 is still a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay a bit more than my initial offer of $120, but I was thinking more along the lines of $140. Would you be willing to meet me at $140?

I appreciate your willingness to pay more, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $140. I'm willing to meet you at $160, which is a compromise that's closer to my minimum price. It's still a good deal for you, considering the value it holds for you.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $160, but I'm still not sure if that's the best deal for me. I'm willing to pay a bit more, but I'm thinking more along the lines of $145. I'm getting a bit concerned that I might be able to find a better deal elsewhere, so I'm hoping we can meet at this price.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $145. I'm willing to make one more compromise, but I need to make at least $155. I think that's a fair price considering the value it holds for you, and it's still a good deal for you.

I appreciate your willingness to make one more compromise, but $155 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $150, which is my absolute maximum. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'm afraid I'll have to look elsewhere.
